docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Russia, Migrants, Malala: Your Friday Briefing

docs.snippet: President Michelle Bachelet will transfer power to Sebastián Piñera, marking the end of an era of female political empowerment in Latin America and consolidating the region’s rightward political shift.

headline.print_headline: In Chile, a Billionaire Takes the Reins From a Socialist Yet Again
headline.main: In Chile, a Billionaire Takes the Reins From a Socialist, Again

docs.snippet: The latest on developments in financial markets (all times local):

headline.print_headline: Markets Right Now: US Indexes End Choppy Day Slightly Lower
headline.main: Markets Right Now: US Indexes End Choppy Day Slightly Lower

docs.snippet: Thousands of people protested in Ghana's capital Accra on Wednesday against the expansion of its defense cooperation with the United States, in a rare public display of opposition to the growing foreign military presence in West Africa.

headline.print_headline: Ghanaians Protest Over Expanded Military Co-operation Deal With U.S.
headline.main: Ghanaians Protest Over Expanded Military Co-operation Deal With U.S.

docs.snippet: The federal government will spend a record $4.6 billion this year to fight the nation's deepening opioid crisis, which killed 42,000 Americans in 2016.

headline.print_headline: States: Federal Money for Opioid Crisis a Small Step Forward
headline.main: States: Federal Money for Opioid Crisis a Small Step Forward

docs.snippet: The United Nations Security Council on Wednesday condemned a barrage of missile attacks against Saudi Arabia by Yemen's Houthi group and expressed grave concern at reports of violations of an U.N. arms embargo on Houthi leaders.

headline.print_headline: U.N. Security Council Condemns Houthi Missile Attacks on Saudi Arabia
headline.main: U.N. Security Council Condemns Houthi Missile Attacks on Saudi Arabia

docs.snippet: The Trump administration's decision to shutter the Russian consulate in Seattle displeased many Russian immigrants Monday, some of whom rushed to its offices in hopes of securing passports, visas and other important documents.

headline.print_headline: Closure of Seattle Russian Consulate Frustrates Travelers
headline.main: Closure of Seattle Russian Consulate Frustrates Travelers

docs.snippet: Peru's new president fell short of reaffirming that the Andean country will ban Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro from attending a regional summit Peru is hosting next month, saying on Tuesday that he would leave the matter to top diplomats.

headline.print_headline: Peru's New President Leaves Summit Ban on Maduro Up to Diplomats
headline.main: Peru's New President Leaves Summit Ban on Maduro Up to Diplomats

docs.snippet: Banks should adopt compensation plans that discourage excessive risk-taking and place greater onus on senior managers for wrongdoing, the outgoing head of the New York Federal Reserve said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: NY Fed's Dudley Says Regulators Should Increase Focus on Bank Executives
headline.main: NY Fed's Dudley Says Regulators Should Increase Focus on Bank Executives

docs.snippet: The United States and South Korea have agreed to revise a trade pact with a side deal to deter competitive currency devaluation by Seoul and with concessions for U.S. autos and pharmaceutical companies, Trump administration officials said on Tuesd...

headline.print_headline: Explainer-In South Korea, U.S. Cars Are Rare, and Often German or Japanese
headline.main: Explainer-In South Korea, U.S. Cars Are Rare, and Often German or Japanese
